required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urodynamics of Suprasacral Spinal Cord Injury Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Urodynamic Findings in Patients With Complete and Incomplete Suprasacral Spinal Cord Injury at Different Stages After Injury

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The medical records of 215 patients with spinal cord injury(SCI) at the Department of Rehabilitation Medicine of the 2nd Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University, Wenzhou, China were evaluated between January 1, 2016 and December 20, 2019. According to the inclusion criteria and exclusion criteria, 101 patients were included. The patients were dichotomized into two groups: complete SCI group and incomplete SCI group, based on the American Spinal Injury Association Guidelines Impairment Scale (AIS) .The investigators retrospectively collected records of urodynamic evaluations of this patients and then analyze the urodynamic parameters,including detrusor overactivity (DO), bladder compliance (BC), bladder-filling sensation, maximum cystometric capacity (MCC), detrusor external sphincter dyssynergia (DESD), maximum urinary flow rate (Qmax), detrusor pressure at a maximum urinary flow rate(PdetQmax).

primary_outcome.description: detrusor overactivity in milliliter,one of the urodynamic parameters
bladder compliance in ml/cmH2O,one of the urodynamic parameters
bladder-filling sensation,one of the urodynamic parameters

secondary_outcome.description: maximum cystometric capacity in milliliter,one of the urodynamic parameters
detrusor external sphincter dyssynergia,one of the urodynamic parameters

other_outcome.description: maximum urinary flow rate in milliliter/second,one of the urodynamic parameters

other_outcome.measure: detrusor pressure at a maximum urinary flow rate(PdetQmax)
other_outcome.description: detrusor pressure at a maximum urinary flow rate in cmH2O,one of the urodynamic parameters

study_pop.textblock: Traumatic spinal cord injury patients with voiding dysfunction and had urodynamic examination.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria were:
1. the period of the spinal shock has passed.
2. patients diagnosed with traumatic suprasacral SCI, based on AIS.
3. urodynamic investigations were performed by the same urologist.
4. patients with voiding dysfunction.
Exclusion Criteria:
The patient with voiding dysfunction before the injury were excluded.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
